result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle W Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Court grants 57 days credit.
TIME SERVED.

Court to apply the remaining 7 days credit, in the total amount of $350, to Cost/Surcharge.  Remaining balance of $93 to be paid within 60 days or penalty of Civil Judgment for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle W Santiago

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice addressed to: Kyle Santiago Return to Sender, Not In Custody, Unable to Forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle W Santiago
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

8:55 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle W Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Kyle W Santiago.  Court first notes that Victim B is present in court today, but Victim A is not present noting the victims are husband and wife.  Court conducts colloquy with Victim B as to whether or not they, as well as Victim A, were aware of the matter proceeding to plea and sentencing today and what the offer was.  Court finds Victim B, on behalf of them self as well as Victim A, are comfortable with proceeding to plea and sentencing today.  Atty. Thompson raises concerns as to whether or not Victim A is actually aware the matter was going to proceed to plea and sentencing today based on the notes from Victim/Witness in her file.  Court will still proceed to plea and sentencing today, based on its colloquy with Victim B, and if Victim A has any objections they may file a motion to have the matter back before the court.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2-5 dismissed and read in.  

Atty. Thompson first notes her office was able to contact Victim A, who confirmed they were ok with the matter proceeding to plea and sentencing today.
Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Victim B presents statements.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Jensen.


COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

50 Days Jail Straight Time (57 Days Credit) **TIME SERVED**

COSTS: $243.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Court to apply the remaining 7 Days Credit, $350.00, to be applied to costs; remainder to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Bail/bond hearing on August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:33 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kyle W Santiago in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Jensen provides an update, he notes he filed a motion to modify bail yesterday and if the State objects to hearing the matter today he would understand.  Atty. Jensen outlines his reasons for filing the motion and would like to be heard on the issue of bond.  Atty. Gordon advises they have not been able to comply with victim rights to hear the motion to modify bail today.  Atty. Jensen notes the victim is present in court.  Atty. Gordon notes that there are 2 victims and is not sure if they are both present today.  Court will adjourn for hearing on defense motion to modify bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Jensen.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:22 AM Defendant Kyle W Santiago in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
